answers.answer: Below 10 percentile ? what does that mean ?

That happened with my first pregnancy. My son stopped growing at 28weeks. I was referred to a high risk specialist and was given a level 2 ultrasound. The doc said the blood flow was great and he didn't see any problems as to why he wasn't growing. My son grew just a tad bit more. I ended up having him by emergency csection at 35weeks due to severe preeclampsia. Apparently even for a premie he was tiny. He only weighed 4lbs 7oz.My husband and i were petrified about me being labeled as high risk and seeing a new doc plus going on bed rest but i assure you those docs are amazing.
I think its to do.with weight..They want to make sure she is still growing,I still have plentyy of room for her!!I guess she is suppose to be at the 10% but instead she is just below it.
I know its scary but just think high risk means extra care and attention and more times you get to see your little one on ultrasound. That's how i got through mine. Try to stay positive. :)
I hope that doesn't happen :( I'm scared of having a c section & Im worried that she stopped growing.g because everything was fine last week
Thank you for the uplifting words!
I know its hard not to be nervous but just trust the doctors & know that everything will be fine ! Best of luck to u & your baby girl

question: I'm worried, ftm 36+6, had u/s done.yesterday, nothing has.changed in my dilation, still at two..But dr said my baby girl is just below the 10 percentile, so I am seeing the high risk dr next week for another u/s..She also checked her fluid and blood flow and everything was good..I was 6lbs 7ounces when I was born, and my de said she thinks she may just be genetically small.When they checked her weight for the first time last week she was 5lbs 4ounces..I'm just worried, anyone experienced this??The words high risk are just nerve racking.
title: just below 10 percentile:...
